basics.name: Joshua Masters
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software Engineer at Altamira Technologies Corporation, contributing to the development and maintenance of software solutions. Passionate about AI and web development, with experience in building full-stack applications and machine learning models.

projects.name: Financial Exchange - Capstone II Project
projects.summary: The goal of this project is to build a functioning financial exchange with client access. In order to do this, it must be fair, fast, deterministic, reliable, redundant, have a full audit trail, and be secure for clients.

projects.name: Messenger Application
projects.summary: Developed a P2P messenger application from the ground up on a team of four.

projects.name: Twitter API Experimentation
projects.summary: Developed Python (PyCharm) programs to interact with the Twitter API, extracting and analyzing data to generate meaningful insights.

projects.name: Detecting Fake News with Machine Learning
projects.summary: Built a fake news classifier system using a TensorFlow neural network model and industry-standard Python libraries.

awards.title: Graduated with Cum Laude Honors
awards.awarder: University of Dayton College of Arts and Sciences
awards.summary: 'Cum Laude - if the academic degree program grade point average is greater than or equal to 3.50 but less than 3.70.'

work.name: Altamira Technologies Corporation
work.summary: Developing and maintaining software solutions at Altamira Technologies Corporation.

work.name: Ohio Department of Transportation
work.summary: Provided technical support for ODOT's Civil Rights & Labor Construction Contracting System, resolving user inquiries and utilizing SQL for efficient data retrieval.

work.name: Kenston Technology Department
work.summary: Ensured technology functionality and created an organized system to track technology assets across the Kenston school district. Excelled as a team leader, taking early responsibility and gaining trust of peers, to ensure seamless technology integration and address teacher needs.
highlights: Managed technology inventory and resolved hardware/software issues.
Led a team to document, update, and clean tech equipment, setup networking hardware, and handle teacher requests.

work.name: Planet Fitness
work.summary: Independently managed front desk operations during overnight shifts, providing excellent customer service, assisting with check-ins and memberships, and ensuring a clean environment.
highlights: Handled member interactions, facility maintenance, and administrative tasks.
Provided customer service, including check-ins, membership inquiries, and new member sign-ups.

work.name: The Country Club at Muirfield Village
work.summary: Efficiently served customers in a fast-paced environment, communicated effectively between customers, kitchen, and management, and adapted to various roles as needed.
highlights: Communicated customer requests and feedback to kitchen and managers.
Adapted to fast-paced service, efficiently handling orders and resolving issues.
Worked collaboratively with team members to ensure customer satisfaction.

volunteer.organization: HANDS HEARTS & HOMES OUTREACH SHARING CHRISTS LOVE
volunteer.summary: Provided weekly meals and essential supplies to over 100 homeless and disadvantaged individuals in Downtown Cleveland.
highlights: Prepared and distributed 100+ lunches each week.
Purchased and provided necessities like clothing, toiletries, and backpacks.

references.name: David Walker
references.reference: Accountability Manager in ODI Department at Ohio Department of Transportation.

references.name: John Molnar
references.reference: Technology Director, in Technology Department at Kenston Technology Office.

references.name: Nicholas Stiffler
references.reference: Instructor and Postdoctoral Researcher at the University of Dayton.
